Title.evidence: Background: This study aimed to enhance awareness and understanding of renal cancer associated with end-stage renal disease (ESRD), focusing on cases where bone metastasis in the humerus is the initial clinical sign.

Trial_Design.evidence: Methods: A case report was conducted involving a 58-year-old male patient with a history of multiple renal transplants and over 20 years of maintenance dialysis therapy.

Intervention.evidence: The patient opted for conservative treatment, with immobilization of the humerus to stabilize the affected area.

Objective.evidence: Background: This study aimed to enhance awareness and understanding of renal cancer associated with end-stage renal disease (ESRD), focusing on cases where bone metastasis in the humerus is the initial clinical sign.

Result_Outcome.evidence: As of the time of submission, the patient's pain had intensified, requiring oral pain medication for symptomatic relief.
